content.prompt: A sphere of mass 3kg attached to a thin string is released from the position shown above. At its lowest point the sphere strikes a block of mass 1kg that is initially at rest. Using measurements of the objects’ speeds taken by two motion detectors immediately before and after the collision, a student calculates that the total kinetic energy of the sphere-block system after the collision is significantly less than it was before the collision. Which of the following most plausibly explains this result?

choices.label: The student made a mistake in obtaining data, because in a collision the kinetic energy must be conserved.
In calculating kinetic energy after the collision, the student did not account for the energy lost when the block slid on the table.
In calculating kinetic energy, the student did not consider the potential energy of the sphere-Earth system as the sphere was released.
The sphere or the block was deformed during the collision and dissipated part of the sphere-block system’s mechanical energy.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
